text.data-name: Articles popped up everywhere when BTS won the top social artist in the 2017 Bilboard music awards. Had it been an award for anything else, many people not knowing them would have made sense. But the top social artist goes to the one with the strongest soc
text.tspan: Articles popped up everywhere when BTS won
the top social artist in the 2017 Bilboard music
awards. Had it been an award for anything else,
many people not knowing them would have
made sense. But the top social artist goes to
the one with the strongest social media
presence; in this case, a whopping 3 million
more votes and mentions than long-standing
winner Justin Bieber. As the 7 member
boyband climbed the stairs to get their awards,
the biggest question was “who are they” and
“how did they get here in a blink”. Here is the
fact, they didn’t.
The Fact is Kpop has been popular in East Asia
for quite sometime now and it picking up pace
in the west was a pleasant surprise to many.
There have been many influential Kpop artists,
but the reason why BTS stood out was a
question many had been asking. To understand
this better, I tried to collect data about the
band and their journey so far. Planning to put
them across other Kpop megastars and see
what is different.
The Rise of
Bangtan
Shinee
NCT127
BTS
EXO
Seventeen
Super Junior
WannaOne

text.data-name: Kpop is varied and the way bands evolve and market themselves can change from agency to agency. But to calculate popularity I had to find a common ground. I decided to go with overall album sales as the reflection of how popular a particular band was.
text.tspan: Kpop is varied and the way bands evolve and
market themselves can change from agency to
agency. But to calculate popularity I had to find
a common ground. I decided to go with overall
album sales as the reflection of how popular a
particular band was.
And here is what I found.

text.data-name: Clearly BTS takes up a huge chuck of that space, Why? There could be a million answers to this. But I had a very popular reason the fans swear by as my hypothesis. The concept and theme of their songs is a the factor that attracts more people towards their
text.tspan: Clearly BTS takes up a huge chuck of that space, Why? There could be a
million answers to this. But I had a very popular reason the fans swear by as
my hypothesis. The concept and theme of their songs is a the factor that
attracts more people towards their music. To validate this, I compared the rise
in sales of BTS with that of EXO, a 12 member boy band that debuted in 2012
and has been one of the biggest names back home at Korea.

text.data-name: BTS music has stayed close to the topic of youth and society, and EXO’s has talked about similar issues through the analogy of being aliens on earth. The bands have a wide variety of genres that they have touched in different albums. The drop in EXO's sa
text.tspan: BTS music has stayed close to the topic of youth and society, and EXO’s has
talked about similar issues through the analogy of being aliens on earth. The
bands have a wide variety of genres that they have touched in different
albums. The drop in EXO's sale is a result of reduced number of releases
every year and may or may not be impacted by the theme/ concept. Hence i
decided to take a look at each band's promotional activity and marketing
strategy.

text.data-name: This article remains incomplete and there are more factors that could have affected the band’s growth, but somethings are worthy of a mention. Apart from the regular promotions on music shows the band has gone ahead and created alternate media to earn prof
text.tspan: This article remains incomplete and there are more factors that could have affected the band’s
growth, but somethings are worthy of a mention. Apart from the regular promotions on music
shows the band has gone ahead and created alternate media to earn profits and create
engaging experiences for their consumers.
Targeting a broader range of art lovers, the band has taken contextual initiative to do their
promotions through unconventional methods, such as games, exhibitions, collaborations with
artists from other mediums, social campaigns etc. The agency created three brands based on
the band which bring in extra revenue apart from just the music BTS creates.
The bands presence on international social media platforms early in their career also helped
grow a global fanbase in comparison to their contemporaries who suck to korean mediums of
communication, limiting the number of people who could acess them.
This explains that the fame and popularity isn’t arbitrary, along with being good musicians the
kpop industry puts in remarkable effort to market their artists the right way and this innovative
marketing is a strong constant in the growth of many big names.
BTS
EXO
EXO Planet 5
Exploration
BTS, love Myself
Campaign
